_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

A person may have little learning and not get the point of learning.
A person may have little learning but get the point of learning.
A person may have much learning but not get the point of learning.
A person may have much learning and get the point of learning.
How a person has learned little and not: Learned little of the statements, songs, discussions, verses, inspired exclamations, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and classifications.
With the little they’ve learned, they understand neither the meaning nor the text, nor do they practice in line with the teaching.
How a person has learned little but has: Learned little of the statements, songs, discussions, verses, inspired exclamations, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and classifications.
With the little they’ve learned, they understand the meaning and the text, and they practice in line with the teaching.
How a person has learned much but hasn't: Learned much of the statements, songs, discussions, verses, inspired exclamations, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and classifications.
Even though they’ve learned much, they understand neither the meaning nor the text, nor do they practice in line with the teaching.
How a person has learned much and has go: Learned much of the statements, songs, discussions, verses, inspired exclamations, legends, stories of past lives, amazing stories, and classifications.
With the large amount they’ve learned, they understand the meaning and the text, and they practice in line with the teaching.
The consequences of learning and ethics: If you don’t learn much and aren’t steady in ethics, they’ll criticize you on both counts, for your ethics and your learning.
If you don’t learn much and you are steady in ethics, they’ll praise your ethical conduct, since your learning has succeeded.
If you learn much but aren’t steady in ethics, they’ll criticize your ethical conduct, for your learning hasn’t succeeded.
If you learn much and you are steady in ethics, they’ll praise you on both counts, for your ethics and your learning.
